content:
Posted: June 27, 2014
												Trine 2 has picturesque and bright visuals, not-quite-elaborate plot and simple but enjoyable gameplay. It's a traditional platformer full of jumping, fighting enemies, grabbing pickups, looking for carefully hidden treasures and evading various traps. Nice fairytale for kids, good time-spending and some eye relaxation for olders and elders.You have three heroes here, the commonplace set of warrior, mage, and thief; they have their own special skills, and game levels are intentionally designed to make use of all those talents. This puzzle can only be solved with mage's help, and that one is almost impossible to come through without a thief.Still, the game often allows several ways to handle an obstacle. You might choose one strategy, and it will pay out; you might choose another, and it will work for you either. It is especially evident when you compare singleplayer to multiplayer experience: a puzzle that you and your friend solved in cooperation turns out to be just as easy to crack when you are on your own.It also has some physics. This means that you can manipulate objects in different ways, making them move, jump, collide, fly, stick, slide, push, support, block, and on and on and on. This adds quite an amount of variability to the ways that you might choose to deal with a certain problem.Last words to say, Steam has acquired a good habit of providing 90% discounts for this game. Catch a good bargain, and you'll certainly have some money well spent.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 15, 2014
												Frozenbyte gives us a second helping of the trifecta in Trine 2. Same as last time you play as a the wizard, the knight and the thief but this time you have to restore balance to the land from an evil witch.The story is fairly thin and only serves as a mean to stitch the 13 levels together. You could breeze through them but you would be missing most of Trine 2's puzzles. As it's predecessor, they remain at the heart of the game. There is a fair bit of combat but it is repetitive and shallow, the fun resides in solving the puzzles. They range from the obvious to the rage inducing but the vast majority stand between the two. All feel rewarding once solved and thanks to video walkthroughs littered over the web you won't get stuck for long.The main star of Trine is it's visual and art direction. Quite frankly, this is one of the most beautiful game I have ever seen. Every sub-section of every sections of every levels is filled to to the brim with gorgeous detail. The amount of visual elements present in every screen is stupyfiyng. You could close your eyes, move the left stick forward for 3 seconds, open you eyes and see a brand new scene.The music, with it's assortment of medieval themes is right on par. Character animation on the other end is superb. For instance I loved how the wizard would bend and hold his hat when standing close to a venting shaft. I was surprised how new animation would show up even late into the game.I do have a couple of gripes with the game. First, the knight feels completely superflous, one could easily beat the game without ever using him. Boss fights repeat themselves and finally, some powers cannot be unlocked until you've played through the entire game. Pros :-Perfect visuals-Character animation is rich and varied-Solving puzzles is satisfyingCons :-Lack of balance between the characters-Combat seems like an aftertought-Achievements and completion needs a second playthroughFinal note :If you love to look at beautiful things then buy this game, it is a feast for the eyes. Solid puzzles, endearing animation and art style makes this game a joy to play.9/10

Posted: May 5, 2014
												Beat this game in one night. And I mean that in the best way possible. I'm hit or miss with indie games, especially side scrollers. But I had a good 5 hours or so of epic, colorful, creative and brilliant gameplay. So it's not the longest game, but if you have the money it's easily worth it at full price....but if it's on sale, you're just plain insane to not get this. It's only $2 at this writing. Best $2 you'll ever spend for the rest of your life, guaranteed (unless Trine 3 outdoes this one then goes on sale).

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 8, 2012
												Trine 2 is a vibrant, imaginative and entertaining puzzle-platformer. It is also one of the most visually stunning games I've ever played. Just have a quick look at the screenshots up there - this game is beautiful. The puzzles are entertaining without being too tedious or frustrating. The game rewards lateral thinking, and there are often multiple ways to complete the same area. The game has a very Fable-ike feel in terms of the music, the environments and the characterisations of the player characters (as well as the enemies). The controls are responsive and the character abilities are fun. I look forward to playing the co-op mode and exploring the DLC. 9/10 - worth every cent, especially at the discounted price.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 6, 2013
												A seriously impressive game with all old-school side scrolling elements we used to love but also comes with a huge amount of added love, quality and detail shoved in ...all for under £1 through Humble Bundle.If you have access to 3D glasses (we use LG's Passive3D because it's better than the rest), this game truly out does it self and looks droolingly gorgeous ...reminds me of that feeling I got from watching Avatar at the iMAX (Waterloo, London) where you really feel your surrounds, the movement of all things organic and with so much depth, it really makes you wonder why this amazing feature isn't a standard in ALL games!So called 'AAA game' designers, developers and publishers should be ashamed of themselves, 'Trine 2' (The Complete Story) is above so many games I've played lately and far more challenging too.*3/3* - My only moan would the sound, as it only supports 2Ch (Two Channel Audio output) which personally drops the immersive feeling you should get from something like this, but it's certainly not terrible and could be updated if they 'wanted too'?

												This game is perfect to relieve those childhood imaginations of adventure. This game offered a bright colorful world with a fary tale story line that brings you back and makes you feel like a kid again. If the story doesn't interest you there is plenty of entertainment with the 3 player co-op. Me and my friends spent hours playing through these puzzles and having fun. Often taking longer than needed because we found ourselves killing each other just for sh*ts and giggles. This games offers loads of fun for friends and has good replayability when ever you're looking to play a fun puzzle game with friends as there are many different ways to go about solving some of the puzzles.

content:
Posted: December 15, 2011
												Such a charming and wonderful game. It has some of the best and most detailed graphics I've ever seen. It's like walking around in a fairytale, the scenery is THAT great. The game itself is actually more of the same, with the big change being the introduction of online co-op. I don't mind though, because the first one was perfect as well. The voiceovers, the music (loved it !), the gameplay itself. Some puzzles were a bit frustrating but thankfully there are several ways to solve them (not all mind you). I do wish it was a bit longer though, because most of you will finish it in 7,5 hours. Anyway, this game (and the first Trine) should be in your collection no matter what. Get going people ![Rating: 88/100]

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 16, 2013
												Trine 2 is a beautiful game. Like, this game came out at around the same time as Skyrim, and just look at the difference (Billy Mays here). The visuals are amazing, and at almost any point in the game you could take a screenshot of wherever you're at and it would be fit to serve as a background. Unlike Trine, Trine 2 has quite a bit more puzzles, and is less reliant on combat than Trine. There's also a huge difficulty spike near the end of the game, that seemingly comes out of nowhere... also, the expansion "Goblin Menace" adds some really difficult levels on top of that. All in all it took me 14 hours to beat the game and the DLC. I don't like Trine 2 as much as the original Trine though, because Trine kind of had an interested plot idea of this vibrant high-fantasy world that had been abandoned due to some evil yet unknown until the end of the game, which was something I thought Frozenbyte did a great job with and I wish they would've kept that feeling in Trine 2, but they went in a "save the damsel in distress (because she was being held captive by her sister)". Anyways, Trine was 9.5/10, Trine 2 is 8/10. If you like puzzles moreso than combat in these types of things, you'll probably like Trine 2 more.

content:
Posted: May 18, 2015
												Buy it when its on sale. This game seems to get high praises, but i think its only alright. I got the game for 2 dollars so it was definitely worth a buy for me. Pros-The art is great and the controls are slick too. -There are many ways to explore and get past a level ( not sure if this was intended, ex. creating a platform and jumping on it in mid air using the wizard) -4 hrs into the game, just when you think its about to get repetitive, the scenery and mechanics of the game varies giving a refreshing feel to the game. Cons-if you're playing coop and you're stuck being the wizard, there's no way to fend off the monsters other than defensively jumping away and/or trapping the monsters in boxes-gets slow after first few hours of gameplay-puzzles are not rewarding to solve

number of helpful: 1 of 5 people (20%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 24, 2016
												Bought this game in 2012 during a sale and shelved it to play at another time. Just recently got around to playing it after forgetting about it entirely. So apparently in 2013 they merged the game with the DLC and anyone who owned the game already had the games name changed as well to "Complete Story" despite not having the Complete Story resulting in some confusion. Adding more to the confusion is that I purchased the Collector's Edition in 2012, however there's no obvious mention of what that actually gave me after they merged Trine 2 with the DLC. After digging around I found out that the Collector's Edition gave me both the OST's and the Artbooks. Sounds great right? Except that if I go and click the Add to Cart for the Artbooks and OST it doesn't tell me that I already had them.This entire thing is confusing as hell.But enough about that, lets talk about the game. The gameplay itself is fun and moreso when you have friends to play with you. I really enjoyed my time playing... HOWEVER... the base game itself is only about 5-7 hours (depending on how quick you go). I put in about 7 hours while partially goofing off before the game ended. 7 Hours of gameplay. This is like NES level of gametime in a game. Actually less, because those games actually had some replay value. This is a puzzle game, which means once you know how to beat the puzzle there's no point in redoing it.Overall pretty damn disappointing. The whole thing was confusing with what my purchase actually gave me from listing the game as being Complete Story in my library when it actually isnt to not making it obvious what Collector's Edition actually gave me. Feels almost like the devs are trying to trick me into forking over more money had I not actually done any digging around on the forums.Story was also pretty cliche.

number of helpful: 0 of 3 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 22, 2016
												Trine is 2d platformer, mostly puzzles and platformers, with occasional action. And I don't think it does any of these things particularly well. Action/combat is bland and just seems like it is randomly tacked into the game to make the knight character relevant, who is otherwise not very useful. The platforming doesn't ask for very much skill and, as a result, isn't that meaningful. The puzzles are okay, but once you figure out how to use the wizard character's conjuring with a little creativity, all of the puzzles become pretty easy. However, the puzzles often didn't feel that rewarding to me in the first place.The story and charm is nothing memorable, but I suppose the game looks pretty.I played through on the default difficulty, but I wasn't hooked enough to try the harder difficulties or to explore for every collectable (though I found a reasonably high percentage of the collectables anyway). I did not play Trine 2 with multiplayer, but this is a reflection of the single player experience I had.I don't think Trine 2 is a bad game, but I'm surprised Trine 2 had such a high approval rating on Steam. I don't find it to be unique or good enough to recommend to a friend over other similar games.

number of helpful: 0 of 3 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 1, 2014
												First thing you have to know, this game looks like it has been Inspired by the Lost Vikings series made by blizzard so this is one good reason to not skip it.A very good and challenging game, but not enough difficulty curves to select.(Normal mode) You either never die since you can return in your last checkpoint's spot to heal your dead partners-OR-(hardest) You die and you must restart the whole stage coz you can't get far without the archer and the mage. This mean the first time, you must advance to take all the bubble. Second time, you must focus on not getting killed and killing the boss that you don't know yet how to kill; not to mention that each stages are very long, but i still embrace this challenge, i just don't rush the game as a result. On that difficulty setting, i suggest to not even focus on picking up bubbles once you have enough to unlock (Ice Arrows) And (Ice shield). You won't get burned-out that way.Gameplay: great combat system, great physics that you can exploit very well with tools sush as the batman's hook and summoning magical boxes along with your surrounding and everything you must do to exploit them. The movement and everything couldnt have been better. Puzzle: It's a puzzle game as well and a pretty hard one. Not anyone, even at hard mode can figure what to do in the longrun.  Each puzzles are fun to do; it's not one of those puzzle games where you want to rush to the next thing just to get over it.AI: I only play hardest mode so my opinion is based on that difficulty only.The enemies are very hard, no delays between their attacks, they move pretty fast, they can climb on almost anything so they will follow you platforms after platforms and 1 of your hero gets killed in 3 hits. With this game, you will be scared of goblins for the first time and they're not even small; they're as tall as your heroes. 1 Goblin is hard enough to beat you down 1on1, but you will still get outnumbered and trust me, you will rage quit.Story:First stuff, good voice actors and the storyline while you shoudln't take it too seriously, it's still good enough for the ride.10/10: Good and accessible for everyone. You can even play it with 3 friends local or online.

												Well, the GAME part of this product is awesome. My kids adore this game.... The UNKNOWN part of this game is alarming. For whatever reason I've yet to determine, this game will open connections to the Russian Federation, Egypt, Vietnam, Turkey, Brazil, Bulgaria, France, Mongolia and Thailand. It also appears to scan your network for other host (for whatever reason). No other steam game that I have behaves in this mannor..... In the 3 days that it's been installed.... It has uploaded 18MB and downloaded 3MB (Non-update related)I am suspicious of the background activity going on with this game. Maybe Valve Corp. can give me the warm and fuzzy about what it is doing. :-/

content:
Posted: April 12, 2016
												Really boring gameplay.  Other than graphical changes there isn't much variety between the different levels and it's too easy as well.  Most of the puzzles require no thinking, the platforming isn't challenging, and if you're just trying to beat the story without caring about collectibles there would basically be no game.  Even if you are trying to get collectibles, if you're in co-op "draw boxes and have another player jump on them" is the solution to getting 90% of them.  Finished the game as well as the DLC and it never becomes harder or more interesting.The one good thing is that the art is amazing, and it's enjoyable to play just to look at the neat backgrounds.

content:
Posted: November 8, 2015
												While this game has charming narration and beautiful visuals, good gameplay is required for a good game.  And sadly, that is where this game is lacking.  Slippery platforming makes it difficult to stay on top of the ever-present bubbles required to get from one point to the next. Combat is dull, requiring button-mashing over skill/strategy.  Based on all the positive reviews I saw on this game, I was expecting a lot, but I was disappointed.

content:
Posted: January 22, 2016
												One of those moments I really wish I could give a neutral review.This game is awesome. It is intensely beautiful, intuitive and flawless to play, smart and puzzling all over and switching between the characters was suprisingly fun.Yet, I cannot recommend it cause after playing it couple times I wouldn't buy it again, not even for the ridiculously cheap price that I grabbed it from a sale. Don't get me wrong it is a great game on so many perspectives, and if this type of game is your thing; get it!! Seriously, get it. But me, personally, I cannot stay interested in it. It's just.. meh. There is no catch for me, I have no urge to go back to it and keep on playing, I have absolutely no need to progress in this strangely enticing game and I started to get quickly bored. So I would be happy giving it a neutral review cause I couldn't find a specific thing to be wrong in it, alas I cannot recommend a game I just don't think is interesting even for 10 hours. It is very conflicting. To give a good review cause it is a good game, or not cause I cannot personally recommend it? Maybe I would have found it interesting if I just kept playing? Who knows, but this is the reality right now. It is still sitting on my desktop after like 2 months, cause maybe, maybe some day I feel like giving it another go, but so far that day has not come.

												Well, the Tank class seems totally useless. I was just following my team, sometimes waiting for them to follow, or whatever. number of helpful: 0 of 4 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 25, 2015
												It's mind boggling how a great idea worked with great visuals and still ended up as one of the most boring side scrollers I've ever played. The first half of Trine 1 had some good levels, but Trine 2 is just senseless. Level design consists of copy-pasted obstacles that end up being tedious rather than rewarding to solve. There's very little cleverness to the puzzles.Play this as a cooperative game or not at all.

number of helpful: 0 of 4 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 24, 2014
												Games like Trine are my least favorite kinds of games. They're not bad enough to drop, but not good enough to enjoy that well. It just sort of trudges along, inoffensive in its design, but never doing much to engage me as a player. The puzzles are a lot harder this time around, true, but I don't feel very smart figuring them out, it feels like a deliberate waste of my time. Maybe it would have been more interesting if there was a story I was invested in, but the plot isn't even revealed to you until halfway through the game, it just starts with "Follow the Trine!"Both games just end up being plain. Not bad, but never that good. Merely not♥♥♥♥♥♥ and never better.Two out of five Lennys( ͡͡ ° ͜ʖ ͡ °) ( ͡͡ ° ͜ʖ ͡ °) ( ) ( ) ( )

content:
Posted: December 20, 2014
												Trine 2 is an absolutely beautiful game. If you enjoy puzzle games and platformers, you'll probably love it.Unfortunately, I'm not a huge fan of platform games in general and I thought Trine 2 was just an endless source of frustration and repetition. The puzzles are fairly easy but as a platformer, the controls are a bit wonky and the movement is flawed.I have to recommend you pass on this one.

number of helpful: 8 of 21 people (38%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 27, 2014
												More of the same. While the skill unlocks add new depth there's little new here. Controls feel sluggish and heavy as before, puzzles rarely challenge, and some skill unlocks are super overpowered... Which I was thankful for when I just wanted to run through and be done with it.... And that voiceover...I get that this is a kid-friendly game, but between eviscerating goblins he pipes up sounding like pre-school story-time.I'd gotta give credit to the art team though, the game is gorgeous. An awful lot of time went into the scenery, but they should divert some of that into making the game more fluid, balanced and... well... fun. [4.5]

												Lemme explain why I'm negatively rating this game:Pros- cool artwork;- cool chars;- funny dialogues;- some good puzzles;- good environment details;- co-opCons- many easy as f*** puzzles;- unbalanced chars (you can easily do the level without either Pontius or Amadeo but Zoya is too good);- unscrollable (with mouse wheel) level choice which can lead to (as it happened to me before I rage quit) mis-level-selection or worse;- UNSKIPPABLE CUTSCENES!!!- some minor bugsBut really, the unskippable cutscenes are too much to bare, specially if you choose to play in hardcore mode

content:
Posted: July 7, 2014
												Some neat game potential here for thoes who like problem solving games. Sadly, this one loses it's appeal REALLY quickly. The "solutions" are either silly redundant, the same thing over and over...or they become impossible to get through. Seriously, I shouldn't have to look for walkthroughs to figure out what insanely random solution they've conjured up or know before I get there that it's going to be the same thing all over again. Bottom line...it's fun for a few hours. After that you'll be making up new swear words and the "fun" dwindles away in hours you'll never get back...
